main_definition: The front refers to the forward-facing part or surface of something, often used in a figurative sense as well.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The foremost part of an object, especially when facing towards another direction
meanings_and_examples.example: He stood at the front of the room to address everyone.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who takes a leading role in action or movement
meanings_and_examples.example: She was always on the front lines of social change, fighting for equality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The initial phase or beginning stage of something
meanings_and_examples.example: We are currently experiencing a new era at the frontier of technology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A position in the military facing the enemy during battle
meanings_and_examples.example: The soldiers took up their posts on the front line, ready to engage with the opposing forces.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The first or most important part of something (often a process)
meanings_and_examples.example: Starting at the front of our strategy is crucial for its success.
